column4: So, I moved my server to my new flat last weekend, all went well.  A couple of days later, my server just died - don't know why, but it did.  It will boot, as far as getting just a flashing cursor on a blank screen.  I can boot an ubuntu CD as far as the menu, but when I select either "run" or "install" it does the same thing with the cursor.  The drive is okay, I plugged it into another box and fsck'd it - all okay.  A
nybody have any idea what might be happening?
try running memcheck86
- oh yeah, forgot to say, I also was able to run memcheck off the disk, and let it do the first couple of passes with no trouble
start removing hardware until it can boot a livecd/usb
- the only thing removable is memory and cpu, unless you want me to dig out the soldering iron :\
- it's a little mini-ITX system I use as a server - it's practially all in one
can it boot another operating system?
not got any to hand :\
your problem is a tough one to solve, im out of ideas

- yeah, me too :(  The only think I can think of is that it's a little warm in this new place, and it's a fanless system, but I don't get why it can run memtest or the ubuntu live cd menu, and then not boot :\
- if it was fried, i wouldn't expect it to be so selective
okay, I got a win95 install disk booting now, so my guess is h/ware is okay
thats strange that it wouldnt atleast bott the ubuntu livecd then
do you have a high end video card by chance?
it will boot as far as the menu, but not the OS
- quite the opposite, it's a low power mini-itx system - and anyway, it's been working for the last year - just suddenly died
hold shift while booting, then press 'e' at the grub menu
k, thx, I'll try it
on the line starting with 'linux'
k, that's where i went wrong :)
okay, I also took out quiet - it got as far as "new low speed USB device using uhci_hcd"
I'm thinking something to do with gfx mode though, as win95 install booted until it tried to start win (presumably GUI mode, previously was the text intro)
